title: Permanent Banned
body: why would an account ever get perma banned?

replies.body: For repeat offenses of things like AFKing, or for being extremely toxic.
However xbox/xbox live cannot ban players for that reason.

there could be a number of reasoning!

-impersonating a Rioter/someone within the company
-hacking into the system, or of other people accounts
-credit card fraud/charge backs
-i would think like devilish as stated afk/toxic but i would assume in those cases it would be like repeated offensive which would usually be dealt with first with chat bans/temp bans, and if those didnt work and its still a problem would only lead to getting your account permanently banned! This would probably go with Harassment as well
-and i would think advertisement usually the people who spam bot others with websites who would think its would help with raising in ranks, or free RP.

There are tons of reasons!
4 of the cases i voted on when Tribunal was active were permabanned.
All of them for ongoing toxicity.
Every permaban has a certain year for its hypothetical duration. 
some are the year 2300, some 2400 etc...
those are codes pointing at the violation the account was perma'd for.

Hacking is the most logical one. 

The only problem I have about it is when you pay money to buy skins. If I buy 300$ worth or Rp and get banned it doesn't make much sense. I know it's a free game but when you purchase in game things you technically "purchase" the game., therefore, they shouldn't be able to kick you from something you own.
I do understand banning an account if the account is harming the game itself. Not the players, just the game.
